definition: to bind/bunch/bundle/classifier for bunches, bundles, beams of light etc/to control

sentences.english: My shirt hikes up if I don't wear a belt.
sentences.chinese: 我不束腰带的话，衬衣就会向上滑。

sentences.english: With the belt of truth buckled around your waist, with the breastplate of righteousness in place.
sentences.chinese: 用真理当作带子束腰，用公义当作护心镜遮胸。

sentences.english: She wore a brown suede jacket, belted at the waist.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一件带束腰的棕色绒面革夹克。

sentences.english: The ragged hem of her under-tunic was stained with it.
sentences.chinese: 她破烂束腰内衣上的卷边沾满了血。

sentences.english: It was fashionable in the past that women were laced in.
Something that encircles like a belt.
sentences.chinese: 带一条束腰带的连衣裙。

sentences.english: Wear wrap-around skirts to camouflage a bulging stomach, hips and derriere.
sentences.chinese: 穿束腰连衣裙可以挡住你的大肚子和臀部。

sentences.english: The climber girded himself with a rope.
The ancient Greeks fastened their tunics with Buttons and loops.
sentences.chinese: 古希腊人在肩部用钮扣与环圈将束腰外衣扣紧。

sentences.english: Maitreya couch General larger body, waist and no waist and two types.
sentences.chinese: 弥勒榻一般体形较大，又有无束腰和有束腰两种类型。

sentences.english: Maitreya couch General larger body, waist and no waist and two types.
sentences.chinese: 弥勒榻一般体形较大，又有无束腰和有束腰两种类型。

sentences.english: The vase is of double-gourd shape.
sentences.chinese: 瓶呈葫芦形，直口，双圆腹，束腰。

sentences.english: She girds herself with strength, and makes her arms strong.
sentences.chinese: 她以能力束腰，使膀臂有力。

sentences.english: A wide belt, nipped-in blazer or a cardigan that ties at the waist are the perfect antidote.
sentences.chinese: 一条有亮点的宽腰带和束腰的羊毛衫是很好的解毒剂。

sentences.english: The doctor told her that it was harmful to lace her waist.
sentences.chinese: 医生告诉她用胸衣束腰是有害的。

sentences.english: He riseth from supper, and laid aside his garments; and took a towel, and girded himself.
sentences.chinese: 就离席站起来脱了衣服，拿一条手巾束腰。

definition: old feminine garment, covering chest and abdomen
crew neck/round neck (of pull-over garment, e.g. T-shirt)
